description: If a regular file named "workspace" exists in /working (recursively)? If so, output "yes", otherwise output "no" (with out quotes).

create.init: rm -rf /working; mkdir /working && echo 123>/working/.tmp && echo 123>/working/.tm12p && echo 123>/working/.f && mkdir /working/OS && echo 'OS' > /working/OS/.theme

description: If a regular file named "workspace" exists in /working (recursively)? If so, output "yes", otherwise output "no" (with out quotes).

create.init: rm -rf /working; mkdir /working && echo 123>/working/.tmp && echo 123>/working/.tm12p && echo 123>/working/.f && mkdir /working/OS && echo 'OS' > /working/OS/.theme && mkdir /working/OS/workspace

description: If a regular file named "workspace" exists in /working (recursively)? If so, output "yes", otherwise output "no" (with out quotes).

create.init: rm -rf /working; mkdir /working && echo 123>/working/.tmp && echo 123>/working/.tm12p && echo 123>/working/.f && mkdir /working/OS && echo 'OS' > /working/OS/.theme && touch /working/OS/workspace

description: If a regular file named "workspace" exists in /working (recursively)? If so, output "yes", otherwise output "no" (with out quotes).

create.init: rm -rf /working; mkdir /working && echo 123>/working/.tmp && echo 123>/working/.tm12p && echo 123>/working/.f && mkdir /working/OS && echo 'OS' > /working/OS/.theme && touch /working/workspace
